title: Executive Assistant and Operations Manager (Internal Audit)
content:
A bit about the role
We’re looking for a proactive and resourceful Executive Assistant for the Head of Internal Audit (HIA), and support our IA team. We are a newly formed team that is quickly growing, therefore you have the unique opportunity to truly have an impact on Wise’s mission, and the way our team functions. 
Wise is helping to build a new world – a world without borders. Built by and for people who live global lives, we are the fairest, easiest way to manage your money across borders.
As we continue our journey of rapid growth, you’ll be the driving force helping our IA team whilst specifically focusing on providing administrative, planning and coordination support to the HIA, Michelle Holmes. You will help us stay focused on executing audit engagements, collating and delivering on reporting materials to the board and audit committees and become deeply involved in IA leadership  processes and the wider business. The role is based in our Shoreditch, London office.  The connections you build and relationships you develop will be the key to the success in this role.
 
Your mission

Provide business and administrative support to the HIA including managing a complex diary, travel arrangements and tracking action lists on a daily and weekly basis; attending meetings where necessary and managing personal time;
Support the HIA on specific Internal Audit strategic and organisation projects;
Actively involved in managing our outsourced and co-sourcing resource;
Leading on and coordinating our inhouse and co source resourcing pipeline (i.e. budgeting, onboarding, coordinating trainings, resourcing capacity), ensuring all projects are appropriately staffed and team members are continuously utilised; 
Coordinate and pull together information for key meetings and reporting (e.g. board meetings, audit and risk committees);
Lead internal communications and cross-team collaboration within the IA team (e.g. organising socials or offsites, keeping internal web-pages up to date);
Manage and correctly redirect business requests to the correct team stakeholders; 
Support and develop IA leadership forums and strategy days, including managing agendas and actions; and
This is a growing team, so there will be other responsibilities and opportunities arising as we evolve…

 
A bit about you:

You have mid-senior level experience as a Personal Assistant/Executive Assistant in a big 4, technology, or high growth company, ideally supporting a global team with multiple demands. 
Experience or exposure to working within an audit team is preferable but not required. 
You act with total discretion and can be trusted with confidential and/or sensitive matters.
You’re excellent at building relationships and leveraging these for better outcomes.
You’re a self starter and love to work autonomously. You’re able to identify gaps and streamline processes with minimal guidance from others. 
You use your initiative and sound judgement to make decisions in a rapidly changing environment with competing priorities. 
You’re able to juggle multiple responsibilities with unwavering attention to detail at all times.
You’re a creative problem solver. We’re not a ‘one size fits all’ kind of company and we’re not looking for off the shelf solutions. You think on your feet and find solutions to problems that are anything but clear-cut.
You have excellent communication skills. You match your communication style to the specifics of the situation, and audience. 
You’re proficient in using Google Suite and other collaboration tools, such as Slack. You’re able to conduct basic data analysis using Google spreadsheets.

 
Some Of Your Benefits:

Stock options
Generous parental leave
Travel to other global Wise offices
Loads of growth and development opportunities
A fun work environment with social activities and events
The opportunity to work with super smart, curious people
To truly make an impact in a young and growing team

Salary (annual)£54,000—£67,000 GBPWe're people without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive. We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
Every Wiser should feel that they can be themselves at work. Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to share their contributions towards mission zero and able to progress in their careers.
Having diverse teams that reflect our diverse customer base helps us build a better product. We can be more creative and empathetic to our customer's needs and life experiences and makes sure we leave no-one behind on our journey to mission-zero.
If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.
Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

demographic_questions.header: Wise Diversity and Inclusion - Voluntary Demographic Questions
demographic_questions.description:
The following voluntary questions are intended to help us learn about the various identities and backgrounds that make up the candidates applying to Wise. If you don't feel comfortable answering you can select I don't wish to answer.

Providing us with this information will help us take actions that support underrepresented groups and make sure our hiring process is inclusive and fair for everyone.

The questions may be sensitive to some, please know your survey responses are secure and optional. All data will be handled anonymously, aggregated and not linked to you.There will be no adverse consequences if you do not wish to complete this questionnaire, or if you partially complete it or you select ‘prefer not to say’ to any question. It will in no way impact your opportunity to work for us within the application or hiring process.

Our privacy policy explains how we collect and process your data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you have any questions, please email hiring-privacy@wise.com.
